info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 20 at 1:49AM AST until April 20 at 6:00AM AST by NWS San Juan PR
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by flood waters from Rio Cibuco continues.
* WHERE...Vega Alta and Vega Baja.
* WHEN...Until 600 AM AST.
* IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Numerous roads remain closed due to flooding. Streams continue to rise due to excess runoff from earlier rainfall. Low-water crossings are inundated with water and may not be passable. Expect many areas of slow moving or standing water. It will take several hours for all the water from these storms to work through local drainage systems in urban areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 145 AM AST, emergency management continued reporting flooding in the warned area due to flood waters from Rio Cibuco. Flooding is ongoing, causing road closures along PR-160 in Sector Arenales, Barrio Rio Bajo in Vega Baja and PR-2 near intersection with PR-690 in Vega Alta. Portions of roads PR-675 and PR-676 remain impassable. Rio Cibuco remains at moderate flood state, with USGS sensors reporting streamflow now around 16.3m. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM AST EARLY THIS MORNING

area.areaDesc: Vega Alta, PR; Vega Baja, PR
